children.value: class is a standard interface for interactions with the methods and events described in both
. These interactions are generally concerned with actions within a colony, such as adding a new domain, creating a task, moving funds between pots, and managing permissions.
createTask.send({ specificationHash, domainId, skillId, dueDate }, options)
makePayment.send({ worker, token, amount, domainId, skillId }, options)
moveFundsBetweenPots.send({ fromPot, toPot, amount, token }, options)
revealTaskWorkRating.send({ taskId, role, rating, salt }, options)
setAllTaskPayouts.send({ taskId, token, managerAmount, evaluatorAmount, workerAmount }, options)
All callers return promises which resolve to an object containing the given return values.
Generate the rating secret used in task ratings. This function returns a keccak256 hash created from the
The string that will be used to generate a secret.
The task rating that will be hidden (
A promise which resolves to an object containing the following properties:
A keccak256 hash that keeps the task rating hidden.
Get the authority contract address associated with the colony.
A promise which resolves to an object containing the following properties:
The address of the authority contract associated with the colony.
A promise which resolves to an object containing the following properties:
The ID of the local skill.
The ID of the funding pot.
Get the total number of domains in the colony. The return value is also the ID of the last domain created.
A promise which resolves to an object containing the following properties:

Get the total amount of funds that are not in the colony rewards pot. The total amount of funds that are not in the colony rewards pot is a value that keeps track of the total assets a colony has to work with, which may be split among several distinct pots associated with various domains and tasks.
The address of the token contract (an empty address if Ether).
A promise which resolves to an object containing the following properties:
The total amount of funds that are not in the colony rewards pot.
Get information about a funding pot.
The numeric ID of the funding pot.
A promise which resolves to an object containing the following properties:
The associated type of the funding pot (
The id of the associated type (
Get the balance of a funding pot.
The ID of the funding pot.
The address of the token contract (an empty address if Ether).
A promise which resolves to an object containing the following properties:
The balance of tokens (or Ether) in the funding pot.
Get the total number of funding pots.
A promise which resolves to an object containing the following properties:
The total number of funding pots.
Get the total number of users that are assigned a colony recovery role.
A promise which resolves to an object containing the following properties:
The total number of users that are assigned a colony recovery role.
Get the inverse amount of the reward. If the fee is 1% (or 0.01), the inverse amount will be 100.
A promise which resolves to an object containing the following properties:
The inverse amount of the reward.
Get information about a reward payout cycle.
The ID of the reward payout cycle.
A promise which resolves to an object containing the following properties:
The block number at the time the reward payout cycle started.
The remaining amount of unclaimed tokens (or Ether).
The reputation root hash at the time the reward payout cycle started.
The address of the token contract (an empty address if Ether).
The total amount of tokens set aside for the reward payout cycle.
The total amount of tokens at the time the reward payout cycle started.
A promise which resolves to an object containing the following properties:
The date when the task deliverable was submitted.
The deliverable hash of the task (an IPFS hash).
The final date that the task deliverable can be submitted.
The number of payouts that cannot be completed (

, it means that the funding pot associated with the task does not have enough funds to perform the task payouts, i.e. the total amount for the three task payouts is more than the total balance of the funding pot associated with the task.
The ID of the funding pot.
The specification hash of the task (an IPFS hash).
Get the total number of tasks in the colony. The return value is also the ID of the last task created.
A promise which resolves to an object containing the following properties:

Get the task payout amount assigned to a task role. Multiple tokens can be used for task payouts, therefore the token must be specified when calling this function. In order to get the task payout amount in Ether,
The address of the token contract (an empty address if Ether).
A promise which resolves to an object containing the following properties:
The amount of tokens (or Ether) assigned to the task role as a payout.
Get information about a task role.
A promise which resolves to an object containing the following properties:
The address of the user that is assigned the task role.
A boolean indicating whether or not the user failed to rate their counterpart.
The rating that the user received (
Get information about the ratings of a task.
A promise which resolves to an object containing the following properties:
The total number of submitted ratings for a task.
The date that the last rating was submitted.
Get the secret of a rating that has been submitted. If a task is in the commit period of the rating process, the ratings are hidden in a keccak256 hash that was created from a
. The rating secret can be retrieved but in order to reveal the secret, one would have to know both the
The role that submitted the rating (
A promise which resolves to an object containing the following properties:
A keccak256 hash that keeps the task rating hidden.
Get the address of the token contract that is the native token assigned to the colony. The native token is the token used to calculate reputation scores, i.e.
token earned for completing a task with an adequate rating (
A promise which resolves to an object containing the following properties:
The address of the token contract.

Get the total payout amount assigned to all task roles. Multiple tokens can be used for task payouts, therefore the token must be specified when calling this function. In order to get the task payout amount in Ether,
The address of the token contract (an empty address if Ether).
A promise which resolves to an object containing the following properties:
The total amount of tokens (or Ether) assigned to all task roles as payouts.

A promise which resolves to an object containing the following properties:
The version number of the colony contract.

The address of the user that will be checked.
The authority role that will be checked (

A boolean indicating whether or not the user has the authority role.
Check whether or not the colony is in recovery mode.
A promise which resolves to an object containing the following properties:
A boolean indicating whether or not the colony is in recovery mode.

must be the id of the root domain

which will eventually receive the following event data:

which will eventually receive the following event data:

Indicate approval to exit colony recovery mode. This function can only be called by a user with a recovery role.
Bootstrap the colony by giving an initial amount of tokens and reputation to selected users. This function can only be called by the user assigned the
for the colony is equal to
The array of users that will recieve an initial amount of tokens and reputation.

which will eventually receive the following event data:

Claim funds that the colony has received by adding them to the funding pot of the root domain. A small fee is deducted from the funds claimed and added to the colony rewards pot. No fee is deducted when tokens native to the colony are claimed.
The address of the token contract (an empty address if Ether).
which will eventually receive the following event data:
The address of the token contract (an empty address if Ether).
The fee deducted from the claim and added to the colony rewards pot.
The remaining funds (after the fee) moved to the top-level domain pot.

children.value: Claim the payout assigned to a task role. This function can only be called by the user who is assigned a task role (
) after the task has been finalized.
The role that submitted the rating (
The address of the token contract (an empty address if Ether).
which will eventually receive the following event data:

The address of the token contract (an empty address if Ether).
The task payout amount that was claimed.
The address of the account that sent tokens.
The address of the account that received tokens.
The amount of tokens that were transferred.
Mark a task as complete. If the user assigned the
task role fails to submit the task deliverable by the due date, this function must be called by the user assigned the
task role. This allows the task work to be rated and the task to be finalized.
which will eventually receive the following event data:
The ID of the task that was completed.

properties.ariaLabel: createtasksend specificationhash domainid skillid duedate  options permalink

children.value: createTask.send({ specificationHash, domainId, skillId, dueDate }, options)
Create a new task within the colony.
The specification hash of the task (an IPFS hash).
The ID of the domain (default value of
The ID of the skill (default value of
The due date of the task (default value of
which will eventually receive the following event data:
The numeric ID of the pot that was added.
The ID of the task that was added.
The ID of the skill that was set.
The due date that was set.
Enter colony recovery mode. This function can only be called by a user with a recovery role.
Exit colony recovery mode. This function can be called by anyone if enough whitelist approvals are given.
Finalize the reward payout cycle. This function can only be called when the reward payout cycle has finished, i.e. 60 days have passed since the creation of the reward payout cycle.
The ID of the reward payout cycle.
which will eventually receive the following event data:
The ID of the payout cycle that ended.
Finalize a task. Once a task is finalized, each user assigned a task role can claim the payout assigned to their role and no further changes to the task can be made.
which will eventually receive the following event data:
The ID of the task that was finalized.

Start the next reward payout cycle. All the funds in the colony rewards pot for the given token will become locked until reputation holders have claimed their rewards payout using

Submit the task deliverable. This function can only be called by the user assigned the
task role on or before the task due date. The submission cannot be overwritten, which means the deliverable cannot be changed once it has been submitted.
The deliverable hash of the task (an IPFS hash).
which will eventually receive the following event data:
The ID of the task that was completed.
The deliverable hash that was submitted (an IPFS hash).

properties.ariaLabel: submittaskdeliverableandratingsend taskid deliverablehash secret  options permalink

children.value: Submit the task deliverable and the work rating for the user assigned the
task role. This function can only be called by the user assigned the
task role on or before the task due date. The submission cannot be overwritten, which means the deliverable cannot be changed once it has been submitted. In order to submit a rating, a
method, which keeps the rating hidden until all ratings have been submitted and revealed.
The deliverable hash of the task (an IPFS hash).
A keccak256 hash that keeps the task rating hidden.
which will eventually receive the following event data:
The ID of the task that was completed.
The deliverable hash that was submitted (an IPFS hash).

Set the task specification. The task specification, or "task brief", is a description of the work that must be completed for the task. The description is hashed and stored with the task for future reference during the rating process or in the event of a dispute.
The specification hash of the task (an IPFS hash).
whose sender will eventually receive the following event data:
